body_html: I runned the tests locally on my machine (compiled without CUDA support). All tests pass, except test_print, which fails at this line because it tries to create a CudaTensor, raising an AssertionError Torch not compiled with CUDA enabled. Maybe there is a way of skipping this test for the CUDA types if pytorch was not compiled with CUDA support?
body_text: I runned the tests locally on my machine (compiled without CUDA support). All tests pass, except test_print, which fails at this line because it tries to create a CudaTensor, raising an AssertionError Torch not compiled with CUDA enabled. body: I runned the tests locally on my machine (compiled without CUDA support). All tests pass, except [`test_print`](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/test_torch.py#L2380), which fails at [this line](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/test_torch.py#L2382) because it tries to create a `CudaTensor`, raising an AssertionError `Torch not compiled with CUDA enabled`. Maybe there is a way of skipping this test for the CUDA types if pytorch was not compiled with CUDA support?
